poem:
**Red Carpet Amendments**

A red carpet  
unrolls,  
soft as whispers—  
wealthy footsteps  
charm coins   
into the air.  
  
Rachel bends,  
a needle in hand,  
adjusting threads  
of finance,  
while invisible threads  
tug the gilded hem  
of promises  
into alteration.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rachel Reeves to soften changes to non-dom tax regime after hearing ‘concerns’ Rachel Reeves has said she will amend the finance bill to soften planned changes to the tax regime for “the non-dom community” after intense lobbying from wealthy UK residents. In the latest evidence of the government’s determination to roll out the red carpet for businesses and investors in an effort to kickstart growth, the chancellor said she would tweak tax arrangements announced in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
